definition: of the same generation/person of the same generation/peer
lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

sentences.english: Here are some simple things you can do to pamper your peepers.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一些简单的事情你可以做你的同辈人宠爱。

sentences.english: In order to survive, he had to be scrappier and more resourceful than his peers.
sentences.chinese: 迫不得已，兰波变得比同辈更加好斗和机警。

sentences.english: Constructive peer (student-student) relationships might influence students' educational aspirations and achievement.
sentences.chinese: 建设性的同辈关系会影响学生的教育愿望和成就。

sentences.english: It’s what sets him far ahead of his peers.
sentences.chinese: 这使他远远领先于他的同辈设计师。

sentences.english: Professor Fang has been a strong source of inspiration for research collaborations with peers and colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 方教授主动与同辈及校内学者进行研究合作。

sentences.english: His humorous rhymes were, however, more often quips and cranks at the expense of his contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他的幽默诗句更多是对同辈人的揶揄和打趣。

sentences.english: I wish they would sometimes forget about their peers and go to a movie.
sentences.chinese: 我倒希望他们有时候能忘掉自己的同辈，去看场电影。

sentences.english: Was Ben Jonson contemporary with Shakespeare?
sentences.chinese: 班强森是否与莎士比亚同辈？

definition: lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people
seniority in the family or clan/position in the family hierarchy
(of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
the younger generation/those who come after
collateral relative (descended from a common ancestor but through different lines)
